meanings.definition: The process of casting concrete elements in a location other than their final position.
meanings.sent1: The precasting of the bridge segments took place off-site to ensure quality.
meanings.sent2: The construction company used precasting to speed up the building process.
meanings.sent3: The precasting of the giant Lego blocks made assembling the structure a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The precasting of ideas in his mind allowed him to plan ahead effectively.
meanings.sent5: The precasting of the stars in the night sky seemed like a magical arrangement.

meanings.definition: The act of preparing or arranging something in advance.
meanings.sent1: Her precasting of the party decorations made the event planning easier.
meanings.sent2: The precasting of the schedule helped avoid any last-minute confusion.
meanings.sent3: His precasting of excuses for being late was both amusing and predictable.
meanings.sent4: The precasting of emotions before the meeting helped her maintain composure.
meanings.sent5: The precasting of the chess moves in his mind gave him a strategic advantage.
